subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Question, How to get the U sound in "Up"?
msgSnippet: Hi Chuck, I m not sure I understand your question, but the u sound in up is represented by the 36th letter in Quickscript. This letter is the arc described
messageBody:
Hi Chuck,

 

I’m not sure I understand your question, but the “u” sound in up is represented by the 36th letter in Quickscript. This letter is the arc described by the upper left quadrant of a circle. If you have Jerome installed on your keyboard it is obtained by pressing lower case a.

 

The sound is called a schwa and is frequently represented by an upside down e as in the International Phonetic Alphabet.

 

If you have Jerome installed on your computer and if your e-mail program can take fonts, you can see “u” sound below:

 

a

 

Your name is spelled:

 

cak

 

gUd wiSes

 

ed

 

e-mail: ed.gaddy@...

phone:  301 390 5115

 

-----Original Message-----
From: chuck091956 [mailto:chuck091956@...]
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 6:18 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Question, How to get the U sound in "Up"?

 

Hello All,

Maybe I'm missing it or my acent if messing me up, but how do you get
the "u" sound like in the word "up"?

Help,
Chuck
